text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I am pritika a cloud support
engineer here at the AWS office in
Seattle today I'm going to show you how
to fix the issue when you can't run
pseudo commands on an Amazon elastic
compute Cloud Linux instance let's get
started
I have logged in on my test instance
running Amazon Linux 2 where I'm getting
this error message while running the
commands with sudo
sign in to the AWS Management console
and then navigate to the ec2 console
select instances in the left navigation
panel
here you can see the ec2 instances that
are running in your account for the
selected region
select the ec2 instance that has the
issue when you try running sudo commands
choose instance State and then select
stop instance now wait for the instance
to stop completely
after the ec2 instance is in stop State
go to actions
select instance settings
and then choose edit user data
copy the user data script under the new
user data field by selecting modify user
data as text
I have used the user data script for Red
Hat based distributions from the
associated Knowledge Center article
note that the user data script for dbn
based distributions will be different
you can find out more about using Debian
based distributions in the knowledge
Center article Linked In the video
description
please note the last two command lines
recover the permissions owner and group
for the custom sudo security policy
plugins in this directory
choose save to save the user data script
now start the ec2 instance by choosing
instance State and then selecting start
instance
connect to the instance using SSH now
you can run the commands using sudo
again
please note the preceding user data
script is set to run on every reboot of
the instance after regaining sudo access
on the instance remove the user data
script this will require another stop
start for the AC to instance
to do so follow the steps we went
through earlier to stop your instance
remove the user data script and then
start the instance
and now you know how to fix the issue
when you can't run pseudo commands on an
Amazon elastic compute Cloud Linux
instance thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
